metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: JavaScript Assignment
JavaScript Assignment Operators
Assignment operators assign values to JavaScript variables.
content.html: Assignment operators assign values to JavaScript variables.

content.code_html:
Operator Example Same As
= x = y x = y
+= x += y x = x + y
-= x -= y x = x - y
*= x *= y x = x * y
/= x /= y x = x / y
%= x %= y x = x % y
**= x **= y x = x ** y

content.text: Shift Assignment Operators

content.code_html:
Operator Example Same As
<<= x <<= y x = x << y
>>= x >>= y x = x >> y
>>>= x >>>= y x = x >>> y

content.text: Bitwise Assignment Operators

content.code_html:
Operator Example Same As
&= x &= y x = x & y
^= x ^= y x = x ^ y
|= x |= y x = x | y

content.text: Logical Assignment Operators

content.code_html:
Operator Example Same As
&&= x &&= y x = x && (x = y)
||= x ||= y x = x || (x = y)
??= x ??= y x = x ?? (x = y)

content.text: Note
The Logical assignment operators are ES2020 .
content.html: The Logical assignment operators are ES2020.

content.text: The = Operator
The Simple Assignment Operator assigns a value to a variable.
content.html: The Simple Assignment Operator assigns a value to a variable.

content.code_html: let x = 10;

content.text: The += Operator
The Addition Assignment Operator adds a value to a variable.
content.html: The Addition Assignment Operator adds a value to a variable.

content.code_html:
let x = 10;
x += 5;

content.text: The -= Operator
The Subtraction Assignment Operator subtracts a value from a variable.
content.html: The Subtraction Assignment Operator subtracts a value from a variable.

content.code_html:
let x = 10;
x -= 5;

content.text: The *= Operator
The Multiplication Assignment Operator multiplies a variable.
content.html: The Multiplication Assignment Operator multiplies a variable.

content.code_html:
let x = 10;
x *= 5;

content.text: The **= Operator
The Exponentiation Assignment Operator raises a variable to the power of the operand.
content.html: The Exponentiation Assignment Operator raises a variable to the power of the operand.

content.code_html:
let x = 10;
x **= 5;

content.text: The /= Operator
The Division Assignment Operator divides a variable.
content.html: The Division Assignment Operator divides a variable.

content.code_html:
let x = 10;
x /= 5;

content.text: The %= Operator
The Remainder Assignment Operator assigns a remainder to a variable.
content.html: The Remainder Assignment Operator assigns a remainder to a variable.

content.code_html:
let x = 10;
x %= 5;

content.text: The <<= Operator
The Left Shift Assignment Operator left shifts a variable.
content.html: The Left Shift Assignment Operator left shifts a variable.

content.code_html:
let x = -100;
x <<= 5;

content.text: The >>= Operator
The Right Shift Assignment Operator right shifts a variable (signed).
content.html: The Right Shift Assignment Operator right shifts a variable (signed).

content.code_html:
let x = -100;
x >>= 5;

content.text: The >>>= Operator
The Unsigned Right Shift Assignment Operator right shifts a variable (unsigned).
content.html: The Unsigned Right Shift Assignment Operator right shifts a variable (unsigned).

content.code_html:
let x = -100;
x >>>= 5;

content.text: The &= Operator
The Bitwise AND Assignment Operator does a bitwise AND operation on two operands and assigns the result to the the variable.
content.html: The Bitwise AND Assignment Operator does a bitwise AND operation on two operands and assigns the result to the the variable.

content.code_html:
let x = 10;
x &= 5;

content.text: The |= Operator
The Bitwise OR Assignment Operator does a bitwise OR operation on two operands and assigns the result to the variable.
content.html: The Bitwise OR Assignment Operator does a bitwise OR operation on two operands and assigns the result to the variable.

content.code_html:
let x = 10;
x |= 5;

content.text: The ^= Operator
The Bitwise XOR Assignment Operator does a bitwise XOR operation on two operands and assigns the result to the variable.
content.html: The Bitwise XOR Assignment Operator does a bitwise XOR operation on two operands and assigns the result to the variable.

content.code_html:
let x = 10;
x ^= 5;

content.text: The &&= Operator
The Logical AND assignment operator is used between two values.
content.html: The Logical AND assignment operator is used between two values.

content.text: If the first value is true, the second value is assigned.
content.html: If the first value is true, the second value is assigned.

content.code_html:
let x = 10;
x &&= 5;

content.text: The &&= operator is an ES2020 feature .
content.html: The &&= operator is an ES2020 feature.

content.text: The ||= Operator
The Logical OR assignment operator is used between two values.
content.html: The Logical OR assignment operator is used between two values.

content.text: If the first value is false, the second value is assigned.
content.html: If the first value is false, the second value is assigned.

content.code_html:
let x = 10;
x ||= 5;

content.text: The ||= operator is an ES2020 feature .
content.html: The ||= operator is an ES2020 feature.

content.text: The ??= Operator
The Nullish coalescing assignment operator is used between two values.
content.html: The Nullish coalescing assignment operator is used between two values.

content.text: If the first value is undefined or null, the second value is assigned.
content.html: If the first value is undefined or null, the second value is assigned.

content.code_html:
let x;
x ??= 5;

content.text: The ??= operator is an ES2020 feature .
content.html: The ??= operator is an ES2020 feature.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
Consider the following code: let x = 5; x += 10; What will be the result of x ?
content.html:
Consider the following code:
let x = 5;
x += 10;
What will be the result of x?

metadata.question: Consider the following code:let x = 5;x += 10;What will be the result of x?

content.question: Consider the following code:let x = 5;x += 10;What will be the result of x?
